channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MD
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MD

item.title: Report X-2024061487
item.description:
Report X-2024061487

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-28T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-23
  • City: HAGERSTOWN
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THE 5 GALLON METAL PAIL WAS FOUND LEAKING ON THE UNLOAD TRAILER FROM THE PREVIOUS FACILITY. THE METAL PAIL WAS DENTED ON THE SIDE CAUSING THE LID TO COME LOOSE AND THE CONTENTS TO SLOWLY LEAK OUT.

item.title: Report X-2024061394
item.description:
Report X-2024061394

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-26T15:13:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-24
  • City: SPARROWS POINT
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: This is a undeclared hazmat.no labeling on outer container.upon inspection contents were improperly packed.14 aerosol cans were placed in box with a one gallon can of non-regulated seal krete that had no clips on paint can.,even though aerosol cans themselves did not leak they are covered in one gallon of non regulated seal krete.

  • City: LANDOVER

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 4-ounces of Green Clean Pro was released from two (2) 50-pound plastic bags due to a forklift puncture by terminal XHG. The release impacted trailer #3192122. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site.
